info.description:
A service to connect Verdus to financial data sources # About The Orchestrator service exposes an extremely simple API for connecting a user’s accounts and data from a third-party provider (e.g. their Bank) with their representative OwnedItem in the Holdings database. Despite the simplicity of the exposed API, a complex workflow is actually executing under-the-hood: * Acquisition of authentication tokens or direct authentication with the Third-Party Providers * Secure storage of Credentials in Runpath’s secure Credentials Store. * Querying third party providers to discover accounts * Connecting Accounts with Holdings Owned Items * Downloading transactions from the third-party account and storing them alongside the respective OwnedItem in Holdings * Establishing a synchronisation schedule which will periodically download new Transactions from the Third-Party Provider. It is the Orchestrator’s job to orchestrate this workflow, while exposing to our Partners a very simple API comprising two key endpoints: Discover and Connect. # Authentication To utilise the Orchestrator Service, a bearer token must be issued along with the request. Details on how to obtain a bearer token, and how to utilise it as part of the request are detailed in the [Runpath Platform Authentication Guide](/document/PlatformAuthentication). To obtain an access token, follow the instructions in the Platform Authentication guide and add the following scopes:
Scopes | ------------- | orchestrator.read | orchestrator.readwrite |
info.title: Runpath.Orchestrator

post.summary: Prepare an Open Banking account request

get.summary: Reference details for supported bank connections
Reference details for supported bank connections for the given softwareId

post.summary: Connect to an item from a discover request

get.summary: Get a connection by unique id

parameters.description: The unique Id of the person
parameters.name: partyId

post.summary: DiscoverItemsForPerson items related to a person
Queries Bank Wizard Absolute to determine if an Owned Item belongs to a Party

get.summary: Get the overall position for a person

createdDate.description: The date and time the connection was created.

lastRun.description: The date and time this connection was last run.

nextRun.description: The date and time this connection is due to run again.

softwareId.description: Id of the software this connections is for.

DiscoverRequest.description: Request to find acccount from providers

parameters.description: Parameters needed for to access channel such as authentication credentials

itemTypes.description: Provide an exhaustive array of item types that should be discovered. Item Types not present will be ignored. Leave empty to get all item types. You must specify either ItemTypes or OfferingTypeIds.

offeringTypeIds.description: Provide an exhaustive array of offering type ids that should be discovered. You must specify either ItemTypes or OfferingTypeIds.

DiscoverRequestParameters.description: Additional paramters for the discover request

authCode.description: Authorization code to exchange for access token

connections.description: List of connections associated with this discover

consent.description: Consent object associated with this discover

ownedItems.description: List of owned items associated with this discover

Position.description: The entire position of a person.

PreAuthoriseRequest.description: Request to prepare for user authorization

channel.description: Channel to use for provider communication

partyId.description: Id of the party for the preauthorise.

redirectUrl.description: Redirect url to post back to after authorization request

authorizationUrl.description: The bank's website to direct the user to
